abstract.para: The SELinux booleans supports a flexible policy management approach. Booleans enable you to, for example, disable a particular policy on one server, while keeping the same policy active on another one. In other words, a boolean can be understood as a switch of a policy rule. Intead of changing a particular policy, you can switch it off. In the policy code, booleans are called a tunable. With the booleans being included in the policy, they are available once a policy is loaded.
The changes to the booleans value may be persistent or just temporary till the session is ended.
SELinux offers tools that enable you to list, view details or change the state of booleans. See the following sections for details.
